section.title: Virtual Directory Preferences
section.para: To use the features of Virtual Directory provided by the extension you need to configure the preferences.

important.para: Unless you have it not done now all gallery items will be hidden.

warning.para: The preference node for this feature will only be visible if you have the plug-in enabled. Refer to Feature Configuration if you cannot find the preference node described here.

section.para: Complete the following steps to configure Virtual Directory extension plug-in:

listitem.para: Navigate to the menu Tools | Preferences.
This opens the Preferences Dialog of Oracle JDeveloper 12c.
In the left hand tree scroll down and select the node Identity and Access Management. Due to the extension plug-in isn't loaded, request to load it.
Click Load Extension. Now the preferences that needs to be configured and are common for all dependencies are visible.
Select the preference node Virtual Directory that's now is visible. Due to the extension plug-in isn't loaded, request to load it.
Click Load Extension. Now the preferences that needs to be configured especially for Virtual Directory features of the extension plug-in.

section.title: General
section.para: To configure Virtual Directory you have to provide in the section General:

row.entry: The directory of your local file system where the applications and all projects related to Virtual Directory are located in a JDeveloper Workspace.
Enter an appropriate name id the recomendate doesn't meet your needs.

entry.emphasis: Path to Virtual Directory Foundation Framework

row.entry: The directory of your local file system where you checked out the workspaces provided by Oracle Consulting Services for development of Virtual Directory artifacts.

entry.para: If you specified the correct path in Path to Consulting Workspace in the preference panel of Preferences this path is already populated for you.
If not either enter the full qualified path in the text field or use Browse... to pick up the directory from your local file system.

section.title: Libraries
section.para: Select the correct Release for Virtual Directory.

important.para: This option determind by your target platform of Virtual Directory.

section.para: After you entered all necessary paths you should press Generate. By doing so the libraries that you may assign to your projects related to Virtual Directory are created for you.

note.para: This activity performs also the validation of the paths that you provided in the section General.

important.para: If an error is reported to you correct the issue and repeat the generation of the libraries.

section.title: Validation
section.para: Validate the existence of libraries created by the step above by clicking Manage... to open the Manage Libraries dialog. Here you can watch if the libraries are matching your environment.
If something might be wrong close the dialog Manage Libraries and repeat the steps General and Libraries.
After you configured Virtual Directory preferences you can select a different preference node.

note.para: It is not important to configure all of them. You will only miss some option in the gallery if a specific product is not configured yet.

If this happens correct the path entry mentioned in the dialog box. As long as such errors are not corrected you will not be able to navigate out of this page. The only option that you have is to click on Cancel and exit the dialog.
